Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2010 03:44AM Mercedes57 wrote: Hi, I am starting Xeloda as well this Monday, same day my radiation is finished.  I was on Arimidex 4 months and lumbar and hip mets have progressed.  I will be taking 2000 mgs, twice a day, 7 days on/7 days off and am really afraid of symptoms, guess they can't be worse than iv chemo?  I don't post too often, but find I return to these posts for comfort and reassurance that others have gone where I am going.  Thank you all for taking the time to talk about your circumtances.  I feel so much hope when I reads your posts. Much love to you all!
Posts.Title: New to Discussions dejam dejam

Posts.Content: Mercedes57 wrote: Hi, I was diagnosed with mets to my back (from MRI) after two months of MD's thinking I had a disc problem.  MDs quickly searched for my primary and I was found to have cancer in my right breast.  A subsequent bone Scan showed no mets in my back, this certainly confused my MDs.  I just have begun treatment with Arimidex (hoping it will shrink the breast tumor and the mets in my back - if I truely have mets!)  Does anyone share this diagnosis of mets to back?  I am wondering since I seem to be able to manage the pain with Ibuprophen and my back pain seems less in the past few weeks.  Are your symptoms more painful, intense?  Drs say that if breast tumor shrinks in two months and back "mets" does not, they will have to find another cause of back problem.  This would mean I am not a stage IV.  Please, can someone relate to this?  Thank you. Dx 3/1/2010, ILC, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: question about metastatic lesions on spine Mercedes57 33skidoo
